reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: This award strives to generate rapid, sustained, and broad-based economic growth. More specifically, this includes a Global Food Security (GFS) Agreement - Headquarters Staff and Training: Funds used to provide HQ staff and training to allow Peace Corps to expand ongoing efforts in Africa to accelerate the food security response.. Global Food Security (GFS) Agreement - Africa Food Security: Funds used to provide funding for a food security advisor and program support to allow Peace Corps to better systematize and expand ongoing efforts in Africa to accelerate the food security resp. Global Food Security (GFS) Agreement - Zambia: Funds used to further enable Peace Corps staff and Volunteers to train and support community partners and service providers in the improvements of food production, cultural and management methods, utilization. Global Food Security (GFS) Agreement - Zambia: Funds used to further enable Peace Corps staff and Volunteers to train and support improvements of food production, and development of food security-related agricultural businesses..
To generate rapid, sustained, and broad-based economic growth.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Despite its status as a lower-middle income country with mineral wealth, Zambia ranks poorly on human development indicators with child malnutrition and its rural poverty levels among the highest in the world. U.S. assistance to Zambia seeks to reduce poverty through the promotion of agriculture-led economic development and food security; combat deforestation and wildlife poaching; expand and improves the quality of health and education opportunities; fight HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria; work to decrease maternal and child mortality; strengthen democratic and accountable governance; and build Zambian capacity to promote regional peace, security, and stability.
Costs associated with activities funded under most reimbursable agreements.
